qas.question: What part of a language can phonology as a word also refer to?
What is another term for phonological system?
Aside from syntax and the phonological system, what else comprises a language?
What sort of language system is phonology?
What part of a language can vocabulary as a word also refer to?
What is another term for vocabulary?
Aside from syntax and the phonological system what else comprises words?
What sort of language system is vocabulary?
What is an example of vocabulary?

context: The word phonology (as in the <b8_0>phonology of English<b8_0/>) can also refer to <a0_0><b4_0>the phonological system<b4_0/><a0_0/> (<a1_0><b5_0>sound system<b5_0/><a1_0/>) of a given language. This is one of the <a3_0><b7_0>fundamental<b7_0/><a3_0/> systems which a language is considered to comprise, like its syntax and its <a2_0><b6_0>vocabulary<b6_0/><a2_0/>.
